description: Replacement of all timber framed windows with double glazed timber framed windows; replacement of single timber door to ground floor rear elevation with double timber framed door and widening of external rear stairs
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the application documents: Drawing 001 Rev 00 (Existing Floor Plans), Drawing 002 Rev 00 (Existing Elevations), Drawing 003 Rev 00 (Proposed Floor Plans), Drawing 005 Revision 00 (Site Location Plan), Drawing 006 Revision 01 (Proposed Elevations), Drawing 007 Revision 01 (Proposed Elevations), Drawing 008 Revision 01 (Proposed Windows and Doors), Drawing 009 Revision 00 (Proposed Windows and Doors), Drawing 1 (Typical Vertical Cross Sections of Existing Casement Windows W1 - W10), Drawing 2 (Typical Vertical Cross Sections of Proposed Casement Windows W1 - W10), Drawing 3 (Typical Horizontal Cross Sections of Existing/Proposed Casement Windows W1 - W10), Drawing 4 (Back Elevation:D2 Proposed Typical French Doors Horizontal and Vertical Cross Sections), Planning and Heritage Statement prepared by ShapeHouse, Design & Access Statement prepared by Traditional Window & Conservatory Company and Windows Replacements for 63 Brentham Way.

Reason: For avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those stated within the submitted application form and approved drawings and documents listed under condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and conservation area in accordance with policies 7B, 7C, 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies D3, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act (1990) and the NPPF (2021).
